steps.title: Get some cardstock, construction paper or printer paper.
steps.content: Get some cardstock, construction paper or printer paper. The card can be made in any color.

steps.title: Make a two snips anywhere along the fold of the card where you want something to pop out.
steps.content: Make a two snips anywhere along the fold of the card where you want something to pop out. The longer the snip is, the closer to the end of the card the item will be.

steps.title: Fold in the part that you snipped.
steps.content: Fold in the part that you snipped.

steps.title: Draw anything you want to add to your card.
steps.content: Draw anything you want to add to your card. Perhaps draw clouds, trees, bushes, and people! Then cut out your drawings, neatly and carefully. In this tutorial, the artist has chosen to draw a snake that is coming up out of the card––it's a good idea to choose an image pose that suggests movement or length, to make the surprise even more exciting when the recipient opens the card.

steps.title: Attach the drawings to the 3D card.
steps.content: Attach the drawings to the 3D card. Use tape or glue to position the drawings in the right spot. Close the card to check it fits well, then you're done!
